Wickie, son of the Viking-principal Halvar, proves his/its courage as more valiantly Viking-boy in the cave of the wolf. However to the true one, hero becomes the clever tot as the children of his/its village Flake are abducted after a raid of the dreadful Sven. At first, he/it admittedly creeps in with the rescue-troop only as blind passenger, however soon he/it assumes control. Because he/it has raised an intelligent plan.

In his/its fifth direction-work, Michael Bully Herbig brings more a hero of the own childhood on the canvas once. The real-filming to the cartoon-row from the 70ern has the makings to lure a public into the cinema beyond the child-target group.

The fear of the wolf is sung of already in the title-song of the animation-series and so sends Bully Herbig at beginning of the adventure in Isegrimms cave like his/its "Wickie." The clever tot completes this examination more successfully, as once it his/its dad, whom with Viking-boss Halvar succeeded. His/its Haudrauf-Philosophie can, in which a clever beheading plays little a sooner after-arranged role, and doesn't want to correspond to Wickie, however. So, the father-son-conflict, that worked 78 consequences long extremely entertaining in the trick-series, of Herbig is established immediately in the first minutes. In order to purify the father and, to be able to wear an independent, real Viking-helmet deservedly, a huge adventure must be survived, and this begins with the raid on Wickies village Flake. The dreadful Sven, played from a terribly well inclined GÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¼nther Kaufmann, has abducted all children of the village. As the Viking-troop sets off to the liberation, Wickiemit then later is the leader with the clever, spectacular plan on board, first blind passenger.

Bully Herbig was everything, which desires the Regisseurenherz, available - whether in the Bavarian whale-little-lake and before Malta's coast sail-capable dragon-ships or a whole Viking-village as scenery. To translate this luxury in matters of provision into wonderful pictures, Herbig succeeds without exception and also in matters of timing he/it shows that he/it belongs to the "strong men" of the German cinema. The history even remains usually previously-sight-pure, but that must be also part of the calculation with gaze on a young public. Figures and history should transport the Spirit of the cartoons undisturbed, therefore Herbig shoulders the parody-elements, that his/its fan-base expects from him/it, itself: He/it gives the narrator, a Spanish chronicler by the name of "Congaz", that 13 at Antonio Banderas role in the Viking-epic "Der. Warriors" reminded.
